OVERVIEW: The Isbell series consists of deep, well drained soils that formed in material weathered from calcareous sandstone and shale. These soils are on mountain slopes, alluvial fans and stream terraces. The mean annual precipitation iu about 20 inches and the mean annual air temperature is about 42 degrees F.

TAXONOMIC CLASS.content: TAXONOMIC CLASS: Fine-loamy, mixed, superactive, frigid Typic Argixerolls

TYPICAL PEDON.content:
TYPICAL PEDON:  Isbell loam, rangeland. (Colors are for moist soil unless otherwise noted.)
O1--1 inch to 0, matted leaves and stems.
A11--0 to 4 inches, very dark grayish brown (10YR 3/2) loam, brown (10YR 4/3) dry; moderate medium granular structure; soft, friable, slightly sticky and slightly plastic; neutral (pH 6.8), clear smooth boundary. (3 to 8 inches thick)
A12--4 to 8 inches, very dark grayish brown (10YR 3/2) loam, brown (10YR 4/3) dry; weak medium subangular blocky structure that parts to moderate medium granular; hard, friable, slightly sticky and slightly plastic; 10 percent cobbles; neutral (pH 6.8); clear wavy boundary. (3 to 12 inches thick)
B21t--8 to 18 inches, very dark grayish brown (10YR 3/2) clay loam, brown (10YR 5/3) dry; moderate medium subangular blocky structure; very hard, firm, sticky and plastic; common thin and moderately thick clay films on faces of peds; 15 percent cobbles; neutral (pH 7.0); clear smooth boundary. (5 to 21 inches thick)
B22t--18 to 25 inches, dark grayish brown (10YR 4/2) light clay loam, pale brown (10YR 6/3) dry; moderate medium subangular blocky structure; very hard, firm, slightly sticky and plastic; few fine and medium pores; common thin clay skins; 15 percent gravel; slightly calcareous, lime is massive; neutral (pH 7.0); clear smooth boundary. (5 to 22 inches thick)
C1--25 to 36 inches, olive brown (2.5Y 4/4) silty clay, pale brown (10YR 6/3) dry; moderate medium subangular blocky structure; extremely hard, very firm, sticky and very plastic; slightly calcareous, lime is veined; strongly alkaline (pH 8.6); clear smooth boundary. (11 to 24 inches thick)
C2--36 to 48 inches, olive (5Y 5/3) light silty clay, pale olive (5Y 6/3) dry; moderate medium angular blocky structure; extremely hard, very firm, sticky and very plastic; slightly calcareous, lime is veined; strongly alkaline (pH 8.6); clear smooth boundary. (0 to 24 inches thick)
C3--48 to 60 inches, light olive brown (2.5Y 5/4) loam, pale olive (5Y 6/3) dry; weak medium angular blocky structure; very hard, firm, slightly sticky and slightly plastic; moderately calcareous, lime is massive; strongly alkaline (pH 8.6).

TYPE LOCATION.content: TYPE LOCATION: Morgan County, Utah; about 3 miles north and 6 miles east of Croydon; 2,200 feet west and l,350 feet south of the NE corner of sec. 6, T.4N., R.SE.

RANGE IN CHARACTERISTICS.content:
RANGE IN CHARACTERISTICS: The mollic epipedon is 10 to 20 inches thick and extends into the B2t horizon in most pedons. The combined thickness of the Al and B2t horizons is 25 to 50 inches. Weathered sandstone or shale bedrock occurs at depths of 40 to more than 60 inches. The mean annual soil temperature at depth of 20 inches ranges from 41 to 45 F.  The mean summer temperature ranges from 60 to 68 F. The soils are usually moist but are dry for 50 to 85 consecutive days during the late summer.
The Al horizon has dominant hue of 10YR, but ranges from 2.5Y to 7.5YR, value of 3 through 5 dry, 2 or 3 moist, and chroma of 1 to 3 dry and moist. It contains 0 to 20 percent pebbles and 0 to 5 percent cobbles.  This horizon is slightly acid or neutral, and 8 to 19 inches thick.
The B2t horizon has hue of 7.5YR through 2.5Y, value of 5 through 7 dry, 3 through 5 moist, and chroma of 2 through 4 dry and moist. It ranges from clay loam or silty clay loam to sandy clay loam with 0 to 20 percent pebbles and 0 to 5 percent cobbles. This horizon has few to continuous thin, and few moderately thick clay films on faces of peds.  It is dominantly noncalcareous but is slightly calcareous in the lower part of some pedons, and is slightly acid through neutral. It ranges from 16 to 36 inches thick.
The C horizon has hue of 10YR, 2.5Y or 5Y. Most pedons have hue of 2.5Y or SY in some parts. It has value of 5 through 7 dry, 4 or 5 moist, and chroma of 1 through 4 dry, 2 through 6 moist. It ranges generally from loam or silty clay loam, to silty clay. A gravelly substratum phase mapped has a very cobbly loam or gravelly sandy loam below depths of 40 inches. The C horizon has 0 to 30 percent cobbles and 0 to 40 percent pebbles. It is noncalcareous to moderately calcareous and is slightly acid to strongly alkaline.

COMPETING SERIES.content: COMPETING SERIES: These are the Cloud Rim, Crume, Kanlee, Maple Mountain, Molyneux and Sewell series. Cloud Rim soils have a solum more than 50 inches thick. Crume soils have 3 to 30 percent pumice ash in the solum, have diatomite or tuff-like bedrock deeper than 40 inches, lack hue yellower than 10YR in any part, and are noncalcareous throughout.  Kanlee soils have a lithic contact at depths of 20 to 40 inches. Maple Mountain soils have 20 to 35 percent rock fragments in the B2t horizon.  Molyneux soils have 16 to 25 inches of solum and occur in a 12 to 16 inch precipitation zone. Sewell soils are 20 to 40 inches deep to bedrock.

GEOGRAPHIC SETTING.content: GEOGRAPHIC SETTING: Isabell soils are at elevations of 5,500 to 8,500 feet. They occur on mountain slopes, alluvial fans, and stream terraces.  Slopes range from 6 to 60 percent. These soils formed in residuum and alluvium weathered from calcareous sandstone and shale. The climate is moist subhumid, and the average annual precipitation ranges from 16 to 25 inches. The mean annual temperature is 30 to 45 degrees F. The mean summer temperature is 59 to 62 degrees F., and the frost-free period ranges from 65 to 80 days.

GEOGRAPHICALLY ASSOCIATED SOILS.content: ASSOCIATED SOILS:  These are the Croydon, Hades, Kilfoil, Lucky Star and Moweba soils. Croydon and Lucky Star soils have A2 horizons and mean summer temperature of less than 59 degrees F. These soils have mollic epipedons more than 20 inches thick. Kilfoil soils have ochric epipedons and are 20 to 40 inches deep to bedrock. Moweba soils have mollic epipedons more than 20 inches thick and have more than 35 percent rock fragments in the 10- to 40-inch control section.

DRAINAGE AND PERMEABILITY.content: DRAINAGE AND PERMEABILITY: Well drained; medium or slow runoff; moderately slow permeability.

USE AND VEGETATION.content: USE AND VEGETATION: These soils are used for watershed, range and wildlife habitat. The present native vegetation is Gambel oak, serviceberry, bluebunch wheatgrass, balsamroot, chokecherry, snowberry, peavine, native bluegrass, and basin wildrye.

DISTRIBUTION AND EXTENT.content: DISTRIBUTION AND EXTENT: these soils occur in northern and central Utah.  This series is inextensive.

REGIONAL OFFICE.section: MLRA SOIL SURVEY REGIONAL OFFICE (MO) RESPONSIBLE
REGIONAL OFFICE.content:
MLRA SOIL SURVEY REGIONAL OFFICE (MO) RESPONSIBLE: Bozeman, Montana
Series Established: Morgan Area, Utah, 1974.
OSED scanned by NSSQA.  Last revised by state 11/74.

REMARKS.content:
REMARKS:
The superactive cation exchange activity class was added in 03/2003 to the taxonomic classification by the National Soil Survey Center on request of the Reno MLRA office, without review of the soil series property data. The remainder of this document has not been updated.
National Cooperative Soil Survey
U.S.A.
